questiontext.text: The standardized regression coefficient of income on occupational prestige is 0.256. What is the interpretation of this figure?

answer.text: An increase of one standard deviation income means a change of 0.256 standard deviation prestige, independent of the effect of the remaining independent variables.
An increase of one guilder income means a change of 0.256 points prestige, controlled for the effect of the remaining independent variables.
An increase of one standard deviation income means a change of 0.256 standard deviation prestige, controlled for the effect of the remaining independent variables.
An increase of one guilder income means a change of 0.256 points prestige, independent of the effect of the remaining independent variables.
